snippet: Newly released letters that the future Pope John Paul II wrote to an American philosopher, Anna-Teresa Tymieniecka, portray a startling affection.
abstract: Letters written by Pope John Paul II to Polish-American philosopher Anna-Teresa Tymieniecka during three-decade friendship have been made public, showing surprisingly deep amount of affection between the two.

byline.original: By JOANNA BERENDT and SEWELL CHAN
byline.contributor: Joanna Berendt reported from Warsaw, and Sewell Chan from London. Elisabetta Povoledo contributed reporting from Rome.

lead_paragraph: Newly released letters that the future Pope John Paul II wrote to an American philosopher, Anna-Teresa Tymieniecka, portray a startling affection.

headline.main: Letters From Pope John Paul II Show Deep Friendship With Woman
headline.print_headline: Letters From Pope John Paul II Portray a Deep Friendship With a Woman
